Package applicationServices.services

Interface PlayerServiceI

All Known Implementing Classes:
PlayerService
public interface PlayerServiceI
An interface representing a service for managing player entities and financial transactions. This service provides methods for creating, retrieving, and managing player entities. It also supports operations such as checking player balances, retrieving transaction histories, and managing money deposits and withdrawals.
Author:
Gleb Nickolaenko

    • createPlayer

      Creates a new player entity.
      Parameters:
      player - The player entity to be created.
      Returns:
      The created player entity.
      Throws:
      BaseException - If an error occurs during the operation.

    • findPlayerByLogin

      Player findPlayerByLogin(String login) throws BaseException
      Retrieves a player entity by their login.
      Parameters:
      login - The login of the player to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The player entity with the specified login, or null if not found.
      Throws:
      BaseException - If an error occurs during the operation.

    • checkBalance

      BigDecimal checkBalance(String bankAccountId) throws BaseException
      Checks the balance of a bank account.
      Parameters:
      bankAccountId - The ID of the bank account to check the balance.
      Returns:
      The current balance of the bank account.
      Throws:
      BaseException - If an error occurs during the operation.

    • getTransactionHistory

      List<Transaction> getTransactionHistory(String bankAccountId) throws BaseException
      Retrieves the transaction history for a bank account.
      Parameters:
      bankAccountId - The ID of the bank account to retrieve the transaction history.
      Returns:
      A list of financial transactions associated with the bank account.
      Throws:
      BaseException - If an error occurs during the operation.

    • getAll

      List<Player> getAll()
      Retrieves a list of all player entities.
      Returns:
      A list of all player entities in the repository.

    • withdrawMoney

      boolean withdrawMoney(String bankAccountId, BigDecimal amount, String transactionId) throws BaseException
      Withdraws a specified amount of money from a bank account.
      Parameters:
      bankAccountId - The ID of the bank account to withdraw money from.
      amount - The amount to withdraw.
      transactionId - The unique ID of the transaction.
      Returns:
      True if the withdrawal is successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      BaseException - If an error occurs during the operation.

    • depositMoney

      boolean depositMoney(String bankAccountId, BigDecimal amount, String transactionId) throws BaseException
      Deposits a specified amount of money into a bank account.
      Parameters:
      bankAccountId - The ID of the bank account to deposit money into.
      amount - The amount to deposit.
      transactionId - The unique ID of the transaction.
      Returns:
      True if the deposit is successful, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      BaseException - If an error occurs during the operation.
